books.title: Backwater
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: A young woman returns to England and takes a job teaching at a North London suburban school.

books.title: Doctor Syn
books.author: Russell Thorndike
books.summary: A king’s enforcer searching for smugglers uncovers the dark past of the inhabitants of a small English town.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Water-Babies
books.author: Charles Kingsley
books.summary: A young, uneducated, and mistreated chimney sweep is reborn as a denizen of the fairy world, beginning a journey of moral and spiritual growth.

books.title: Jeeves Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring Jeeves and Wooster and the upperclass English life of the early 1900s.

books.title: Our American Cousin
books.author: Tom Taylor
books.summary: A rough American from a distant branch of the Trenchard family returns to England and quickly becomes embroiled in the family’s affairs.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: A Hazard of New Fortunes
books.author: William Dean Howells
books.summary: A Boston-based editor moves his family to Gilded Age New York, where they’re soon caught up in the many struggles taking place there.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: Ralestone Luck
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: The descendants of a noble family, and of pirates, seek to restore their fortunes by locating the “luck” of their family.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: The Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.summary: The epic poem which follows a Greek warrior who refuses to give up his prize of war.

books.title: Gulliver’s Travels
books.author: Jonathan Swift
books.summary: An Englishman travels to fictional islands where he meets tiny people, giants, magicians and talking horses.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Walter M. Miller Jr.
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Walter M. Miller Jr., ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.
